column1: #### Stuff that doesn't fit into a specific category

column2: A terrible plague is devastating this county.

A bureaucratic administration relies on civil administrators, that can be appointed and dismissed at will, and less on landed vassals. Rulers can personally rule more territory, and maintain more experienced professional soldiers. This system, however, is dependent on the stability of their domains, and should it slip too low, a terrible fate shall be met...

Stability measures how stable the government is against both internal and external threats. At lower stability, our tax efficiency decreases and we may even face challenges from ambitious generals and governors.
The realm is slightly destabilized. Ambitious governors may seek fame and fortune by launching foreign expeditions on their own.
The realm is greatly destabilized. Squabbles between governors may turn into all-out-war, and ambitious governors may turn their attentions towards their weak ruler (which would be you).
Our Bureaucracy can either be aristocratic, relying more in soldiers and military commanders, or plutocratic, relying instead in proper administrators.
The governors of our territories are expected to provide even more taxes rather than soldiers.
The governors of our territories are expected to provide taxes rather than soldiers..
The governors of our territories are expected to provide taxes and soldiers in equal amounts
The governors of our territories are expected to provide soldiers rather than taxes.
The governors of our territories are expected to provide even more soldiers rather than taxes.
Caesar was a title usually bestowed upon a designated heir and then retained upon ascension
Proconsul was a title bestowed upon provincial governors such as Vicars.
Adiutor was a title denoting a senior court adjutant or assistant.
Subadiuvae was a title denoting lesser court adjutants or assistants
The Commentariensis was the keeper of the Commentary, or the official diary.
The Ab actis, literally "Acts Keeper", was the court archivist.
The Cura Epistolarum was the curator of correspondence in the late Roman Empire.

The major departments of the Emperor's court and household had a chief that was styled "Comes", with an officium (staff) quite similar to that of a governor. The Comes Dispositonum was responsible for organizing the imperial calendar and preparing the correspondence for distribution to the proper offices for transcription.

The major departments of the Emperor's court and household had a chief that was styled "Comes", with an officium (staff) quite similar to that of a governor. The Comes Domesticorum was the head of the Domestici, a company of bodyguards stationed in the imperial palace with the task of protecting the emperor.

The major departments of the Emperor's court and household had a chief that was styled "Comes", with an officium (staff) quite similar to that of a governor. The Comes Rerum Privatarum was responsible for the private estates or holdings of the emperor and his family.

The major departments of the Emperor's court and household had a chief that was styled "Comes", with an officium (staff) quite similar to that of a governor. The Comes Sacrarum Largitionum operated most of the imperial finances. He controlled all of the mints, was also responsible for the yields of the mines, provided budgets for the civil service, and collected customs duties and land taxes. His competence also included several minor Comites.

The major departments of the Emperor's court and household had a chief that was styled "Comes", with an officium (staff) quite similar to that of a governor. The Comes Sacrae Vestis was the master of the wardrobe of the emperor.
This character is very tolerant to members of different christian sects, and is much less likely to persecute these people.
This character is currently in charge of a realm wide Quarantine.
The realm is in a state of Tamtruyt, leaving the government without power and a general anarchy throughout the realm.
A Quarantine is Placed on your Realm...
The people in this province are experiencing a Quarantine, banning foreigners, placing curfews, and isolating those with disease symptoms.
All ships entering the trade post in this province must now wait for 40 days before then having the ship checked to enter this port.
A Holy Tree has been found in this province, making it a center of theological discussion.
This character has held a mass animal sacrifice according to the ancient traditions of the Alamannians.
Celebrate the coming of summer with a Beltane Festival
Prepare the ceremonial hunt in the name of Lugh to commemorate the beginning of the harvest season.
Hold the holy festival commemorating the start of winter, and Lugh's death to the God of Misrule.
You brought rain to your troubled people.
Prepare the holy celebration of summer.
Merchants from the East have brought a great disease to this province.
This provinces is experiencing open trade, causing an influx of cultures, religions, and wealth into the area.
The trade routes in this provinces are not very safe, causing many merchants to travel in fear, if they do at all.
[This.GetTitledFirstName] wants to become King of [This.Capital.Kingdom.GetName]. If pagan, it allows [This.GetObjectPronoun] the unlimited use of the Subjugation Casus Belli within the kingdom.
column3: [This.GetTitledFirstName] désire devenir roi de [This.Capital.Kingdom.GetName]. S'il est païen, cela permet à/au [This.GetObjectPronoun] l'utilisation illimitée de l'assujettissement casus belli au sein du royaume.
column4: [This.GetTitledFirstName] möchte König von [This.Capital.Kingdom.GetName] werden. Bei heidnischer Herrschaft erlaubt dies [This.GetObjectPronoun] die unbegrenzte Verwendung des Kriegsgrunds Unterwerfung in diesem Königreich.
column6: [This.GetTitledFirstName] quiere convertirse en Rey de [This.Capital.Kingdom.GetName]. Si es pagano, permite a [This.GetObjectPronoun] el uso ilimitado de la Casus Belli Subyugación dentro del reino.

column2: We cannot join our vassals' wars (except for Crusades/Jihads)
column3: Nous ne pouvons pas participer aux guerres menées par nos vassaux (sauf les croisades/jihads).
column4: Wir können uns den Kriegen unserer Vasallen nicht anschließen (außer den Kreuzzügen/ Dschihads)
column6: No podemos unirnos a la guerra de nuestros vasallos (salvo para cruzadas/yihads)

column2: Decadence lost from grant to dynasty member: §G$DECADENCE$%§!.
column3: Décadence perdue due aux terres accordées aux membres de ma dynastie : §G$DECADENCE$%§!.
column6: Perdida de Decadencia por conceder un título a un familiar

column2: Our Imperial administration allows us to revoke our rightful capital of §Y$CAPITAL$§! without objections from the aristocracy.
column3: Notre administration impériale nous permet de révoquer notre capital qui lui revient de §Y$CAPITAL$§! sans objection de la part de l'aristocratie.
column4: Unsere kaiserlichen Verwaltung ermöglicht es uns, unseren rechtmäßigen Hauptstadt §Y$CAPITAL$§! ohne Einwände von der Aristokratie widerrufen.
column6: Nuestra administración imperial nos permite revocar nuestra capital que le corresponde de §Y$CAPITAL$§! sin objeciones por parte de la aristocracia.

column2: With the ambition to become king of §Y[PrimaryTitle.GetName]§!, §Y[GetTitledFirstName]§! is not allowed to move the capital outside the de jure kingdom.
column3: Avec l'ambition de devenir roi de §Y[PrimaryTitle.GetName]§!, §Y[GetTitledFirstName]§! n'est pas autorisé à déplacer la capitale à l'extérieur du royaume de jure.
column4: Mit der Ambition, König von §Y[PrimaryTitle.GetName]§! zu werden, darf §Y[GetTitledFirstName]§! die Hauptstadt nicht außerhalb des de jure Königreichs verlegen..
column6: Con la ambición de convertirse en Rey de §Y[PrimaryTitle.GetName]§!, a §Y[GetTitledFirstName]§! no se le permite mover su capital fuera del Reino de jure.

column2: Temporary title holders cannot destroy any titles
column3: Les titulaires de titres temporaires ne peuvent pas détruire de titres.
column4: Vorübergehende Titelträger können keine Titel zerstören
column6: Titulares temporales no pueden destruir ningún título

column2: Cannot Create a Title While Holding A Temporary Title
column3: Impossible de créer un titre tout en détenant un titre temporaire.
column4: Ihr könnt keine Titel erschaffen während ihr einen temporären Titel innehabt
column6: No puedes crear un título mientras posees un título temporal

column2: Training grounds where the castle levies can practise and ready themselves for the inevitability of war.
column3: Des terrains d'entraînement où les troupes du château veut s'exercer et se préparer à une guerre inévitable.
column4: Übungsplätze, auf denen das Burgheer üben und sich auf den unvermeidlichen Krieg vorbereiten kann.
column6: Campos de entrenamiento donde las levas del castillo pueden practicar y prepararse para la inevitabilidad de la guerra.

column2: This where the adult men of the city muster to join the militia in times of war.
column3: C'est ici que les hommes de la cité se rassemblent pour se joindre à la milice en temps de guerre.
column4: Hier werden die erwachsenen Männer der Stadt einberufen, um in Kriegszeiten der Miliz beizutreten.
column6: Aquí se congregan los hombres adultos de la ciudad para unirse a la milicia en tiempos de guerra.

column2: The ruler and all vassals at one and two ranks below can nominate an heir - the new ruler - from among the members of the ruler's dynasty. Vassals will tend to favor older members from other branches of the family, especially claimants.
A Scop is a form of Anglo-Saxon bard, who is a favored entertainer in the rulers' court.
The Helm is a chosen protector of the ruler, and a valued confidant in times of trouble.
A Folcwine is a friend of the people, and it is a honor to be considered so by the ruler.
The Sigecempa is an incredible honor, being the victorious champion of your people.
This kingdom is ruling normally, without the aid of tyranny.
This kingdom is ruled with an iron fist, angering the people but instilling fear into many.
